intro: Corybas fanjingshanensis, commonly known as the Fanjingshan hooded orchid, is a rare and unique orchid species native to China. It belongs to the Epidendroideae subfamily and is characterized by its distinctive, hood-like flower structure. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, often on rocky substrates. Its flowers are usually dark-colored, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
